content:
Honor exists to expand the world’s capacity to care.
We’re combining high tech with high-touch to deliver better home care for aging adults, better jobs for Care Professionals, and entirely new offerings to support the aging journey, at scale. 
Founded in 2014, and now a Series E funded “Unicorn” valued at over $1B, Honor leads the world’s largest home care network with the most advanced care platform. Our August 2021 acquisition of Home Instead has created a global company that’s revolutionizing how society cares for older adults, their families, and Care Professionals.
The Honor Care Platform combines local care and the most advanced technology to bring the highest quality care to more aging adults. 
Grow at Honor as part of a united team where everyone shows up authentically, shares ideas bravely, and solves complex problems! 
About the Work:We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Franchise Network Sales Strategy Manager to spearhead the development and future leadership of a high-performing team dedicated to creating and executing effective sales strategies, tools, and programs for our franchise network. You will play a pivotal role in crafting a comprehensive strategy aimed at empowering our network and their respective teams to drive business growth through the acquisition of new clients, while also focusing on nurturing and retaining existing clients. 
 
Key Responsibilities:

Strategy Development: Develop and refine sales strategies for client acquisition and retention in collaboration with the Network Performance team 
Training Program Design: Develop and enhance sales training programs tailored to our franchise network's needs, for consistent and effective use nationally.
Program Management: Execute the sales training strategy, monitoring program implementation for optimal results. Oversee day-to-day program management
Communication and Presentation: Effectively communicate strategies and deliver engaging and effective training sessions to local franchises
Sales Enablement: Provide guidance and resources to franchisees for successful execution of sales strategies.
Client Acquisition: Facilitate lead generation techniques to drive new client acquisition.
Client Retention: Develop initiatives to enhance client retention strategies.
Future Team Leadership: Manage and mentor a Network Sales Training Specialist dedicated to sales training excellence
Reporting and Analysis: Regularly assess program effectiveness through data analysis and feedback mechanisms. Utilize data-driven insights to evaluate program impact.

 
About You:
You are an experienced salesperson who is ready to share your knowledge across a diverse audience of Home Instead franchise owners, in support of our in market sales strategy. This role is ideal if you're a dynamic, adaptable self-starter with strong communication skills, adept at crafting effective strategies, programs, and tools to drive business growth for franchise owners. 
Our ideal candidate will have:

5+ years of sales experience including: outside sales, B2C, SMB/mid-market, Referral Partner selling, and/or home health 
3-5+ years of assessing and optimizing existing sales strategies, building new sales strategies, and executing successful sales techniques
Experience in Home Care, B2C Medical, Home Health or related area of focus 
Experience with collecting and analyzing data as well as data driven decision making 
Experience or desire to manage others
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Exceptional time management capabilities
Experience creating an ongoing communication and education strategy for sales strategies and tools
Ability to swiftly adapt direction and strategy as needed

demographic_questions.description:
At Honor, one of our core values is Our Differences Propel Us - we welcome the full range of lived experiences and core identities, inclusive of everyone, and believe that our diverse experiences and opinions inspire the novel approaches we need to amplify our impact. We are also committed to our continued diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) efforts. 

We invite you to complete this optional confidential survey to help us evaluate our recruitment efforts, model diversity and equity best practices, and continue to translate our core values into action. 

Providing this information is strictly voluntary. This information will be kept secure, will not be used in the hiring process, and will be accessible to a small group to be used solely to evaluate our DEI efforts, as part of our continued commitment to an inclusive work environment.

Please reach out to us with any questions about the work and use of this information.
